newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: At least six die in sectarian attack in Pakistan.
newsitem.headline: At least six die in sectarian attack in Pakistan.

text.p: Gunmen killed at least six Shi'ite Moslems while they slept on the street in Pakistan's Punjab province on Saturday, hospital sources said.

They said the unidentified attackers swept through the village of Mondka, in Khangarh district, on motorcycles at 4 a.m. (2300 GMT Friday), firing at residents who were sleeping outside to escape the summer heat.
The dead included the local head of the Shi'ite Tehrik-i-Jafria group, identified only as Mushtaq, and several of his relatives, the sources said.
One person was critically wounded and taken to hospital in the city of Multan, about 28 miles (45 km) east of Mondka.
His son, Sayed Asif Shah, who witnessed the assault but escaped unhurt, told Reuters that four gunmen on motorcycles had selected their victims before shooting them in the head.
The attack appeared to part of a long-running feud between Sunni and Shi'ite militants in populous Punjab province which has cost more than 136 lives this year.
